subject.geographic: Near Washington, Parish of St. Landry, La

mods.abstract: RUNAWAY, FROM the undersigned near Washington, Parish of St. Landry, on the 1st of May inst. a negro man griff color named Ephraim, aged about 22 years, about 5 feet 11 inches high, raw bone, having a scar about his face, a few spots about his mouth and a mark on one of his cheecks ; --was bought in March last from Mr. Elam, a negro trader in New Orleans. A liberal reward will be given for his delivery to the undersigned or for his lodging in one of the jails of this state. Wm. F. DAVIS. St. Landry, May 19th, 1860. The N.O. Delta will please coppy in English one month weekly, and send bill to the office of the Opelousas Courier.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
